Hi Christofer, 

Given the fact that the nodes have a position in 3D space,=
 it is easy 
to run a HyperNEAT evolution in a 3D substrate. You can provid=
e a 
bias (distance between nodes) to encourage relationships between 
node=
s close to each other in space. 
What do you mean by "gravitating"? Nodes w=
ill change position over 
time? It is not really necessary. Just position t=
he nodes in such a 
geometric way that is meaningful to you and the problem=
 at hand, then 
leave all the learning to HyperNEAT. 

Peter

ahoogroups.com, "christofer_fransson" 
<christofer_fransson@...> wrote:

>=
 Dear all,

nd of

couraging a network to divide a problem into smaller sub problems

n solve it.

 coordinates (x,y,z)

forming well in 
one
> epoch 
> (Backprop run, network weights that didn't =
have to be changed much 
etc)
> - All those nodes should "gravitate" toward=
s each other

m a
> connection.

 to be modular.

arn math and when you are painting, different
